briefTitle: Effectiveness of Sitagliptin for HIV Insulin Resistance and Inflammation
officialTitle: A Double Blind, Randomized, Placebo Controlled Study to Determine the Physiological Effectiveness of Januvia for Reducing Inflammation and Increasing EPC Number in HIV Infected Men and Women With Insulin Resistance and Central Adiposity.
summary: People living with human immunodeficiency virus infection (HIV) have 2-4fold greater risk for developing diabetes and heart disease than the general population. They need safe and effective treatments that reduce the risk for developing diabetes and heart disease, and improve their quality of life. This project will explore whether a new anti-diabetes medication (Januvia) with a novel mechanism of action reduces inflammation, and improves blood vessel function in HIV infected men and women with several risk factors for developing cardiovascular disease.
